text: We welcome the progress and take note with appreciation of the interim report published by the High-level Panel on the Development of a Multidimensional Vulnerability Index for Small Island Developing States and look forward to the finalization of the work of the Panel, and we encourage the international community to consider multidimensional vulnerability, including the potential of a multidimensional vulnerability index, as criteria to access concessional finance.

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: High-level Panel on MVI for SIDS
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: High-level Panel on the Development of a Multidimensional Vulnerability Index for Small Island Developing States

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Criteria for concessional finance

textWithHighlights: We *welcome* the progress and *take note with appreciation* of the interim report published by the {{High-level Panel on the Development of a Multidimensional Vulnerability Index for Small Island Developing States}} and *look forward* to the finalization of the work of the Panel, and we *encourage* the <<international community>> to consider multidimensional vulnerability, including the potential of a multidimensional vulnerability index, as [[criteria to access concessional finance]].
uncertainties: Classified 'criteria to access concessional finance' as a policy deliverable, though the text only encourages consideration rather than adoption; this is somewhat borderline.

text: We will invest in enhancing the capacity and capability of developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, landlocked developing countries and small island developing States, for disaster risk reduction by strengthening capacity-building investment and programmes at the national, regional and global levels, such as the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction Global Education and Training Institute.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strengthened capacity-building investments and programmes for disaster risk reduction

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction Global Education and Training Institute

textWithHighlights: We will invest in enhancing the capacity and capability of {{developing countries}}, in particular the {{least developed countries}}, {{landlocked developing countries}} and {{small island developing States}}, for disaster risk reduction by strengthening [[capacity-building investment and programmes]] at the national, regional and global levels, such as the {{United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction Global Education and Training Institute}}.
uncertainties: The paragraph uses "We will" without a procedural operative verb; the implied assignee could be the General Assembly or Member States collectively, but it is not explicit, so no assignee is recorded.

text: We recognize that North-South cooperation, complemented by South-South and triangular cooperation, has proven to be key to reducing disaster risk and that there is a need to further strengthen cooperation in both areas.
textWithHighlights: We *recognize* that North-South cooperation, complemented by South-South and triangular cooperation, has proven to be key to reducing disaster risk and that there is a need to further strengthen cooperation in both areas.

text: We note the ongoing work of the United Nations system to develop a gender action plan for the implementation of the Sendai Framework.
textWithHighlights: We *note* the ongoing work of the {{United Nations system}} to develop a gender action plan for the implementation of the Sendai Framework.

text: We call upon relevant entities of the United Nations system, within their respective mandates, to enhance support for the implementation of the Sendai Framework and the calls to action contained in the present political declaration. We further call for the integration of disaster risk reduction in the common country analysis and in United Nations planning and programming documents, including the United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework, in consultation with host Governments and in line with national policies, priorities and needs.

assignees.assignee: relevant entities of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integration of disaster risk reduction into UN planning and programming documents (including the United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework)

textWithHighlights: We *call upon* <<relevant entities of the United Nations system>>, within their respective mandates, to enhance support for the implementation of the Sendai Framework and the calls to action contained in the present political declaration. We further *call for* the [[integration of disaster risk reduction]] in the common country analysis and in United Nations planning and programming documents, including the United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework, in consultation with {{host Governments}} and in line with national policies, priorities and needs.
uncertainties: Categorized the integration into planning and programming documents as a 'policy' deliverable; could arguably be seen as part of a 'strategy' depending on context.

text: We call upon relevant entities of the United Nations system to enhance technical support, when requested, for the development of disaster risk reduction standards, legislation and regulations; comprehensive risk governance; data collection, disaggregation and monitoring; risk analytics; de-risking investments; and accessible multi-hazard early warning systems. We encourage all existing and new donors to consider enhancing and providing voluntary contributions to the United Nations trust fund for disaster reduction.

assignees.assignee: entities of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: technical support
voluntary contributions

textWithHighlights: We *call upon* relevant <<entities of the United Nations system>> to enhance [[technical support]], when requested, for the development of disaster risk reduction standards, legislation and regulations; comprehensive risk governance; data collection, disaggregation and monitoring; risk analytics; de-risking investments; and accessible multi-hazard early warning systems. We *encourage* all existing and new <<donors>> to consider enhancing and providing [[voluntary contributions]] to the United Nations trust fund for disaster reduction.
uncertainties: "Donors" is normalized as a generic group under type "other" since it is not explicitly listed in the entity taxonomy. The specific trust fund is mentioned but not mapped to a listed entity.
